node.title: Abuse in care inquiry: Boys' home 'beginning of my criminal career'
node.description: They were supposed to be a sanctuary for tamariki taken away from a world of abuse, but for those placed in Social Welfare facilities in the 1970s and '80s, they were houses of pain and fear.

node.title: 'This is a 1939 moment': UN must force Russia's exit from Ukraine - top general
node.description: The world must stand as one against Russian President Vladimir Putin even if he threatens the nuclear option, a former NATO commander says. Audio

node.title: Pope renews calls to end war in Ukraine: "In the name of God, stop!"
node.description: "Think first about the children, about those who are deprived of the hope for a dignified life," he tweeted.

node.title: "Bomb cyclone" dumping snow from Mississippi to Maine
node.description: The storm could cause travel problems and power outages across a wide part of the Eastern United States through early next week.

node.title: Saudi Arabia says it executed 81 convicts in a single day
node.description: Those executed were convicted of crimes ranging from killings to belonging to militant groups.

node.title: Russian forces close in on Kyiv and bombard Mariupol
node.description: The U.S. is deploying additional troops to Eastern Europe to support NATO forces. It's also sending more weapons and billions of dollars in aid to Ukraineâ€‹.

node.title: Russia to supply military equipment to Belarus, Belarus news agency says
node.description: Ukraine says Belarus could be planning to invade its territory and accused Russia of trying to drag its ally into the war by staging air attacks on Belarus from Ukrainian air space.

node.title: Russia to lose 'most favoured nation status' over Ukraine - sources
node.description: The US, G7 and the EU are moving to revoke Russia's "most favoured nation" status over its invasion of Ukraine, sources say.

node.title: Funding concerns over Westport flood
node.description: An urgent $10m flood protection scheme for Westport could grow larger, with the cost falling on ratepayers if central Government doesn't contribute.

node.title: CDC revokes U.S. authority to expel migrant children
node.description: A federal court last week had ruled that the administration could not exempt unaccompanied children from a Trump-era border restriction.

node.title: Up to 40% of Wellington council teams off sick, services slashed
node.description: Wellington City Council has been forced to limit and halt services such as roading and recycling, as Covid-19 sweeps through its workforce and contractors.

node.title: Ohio officer cleared in shooting of teenager Ma'Khia Bryant
node.description: Bryant was killed in April by Columbus police officer Nicholas Reardon as she appeared to swing a knife at a young woman, just seconds after pushing another woman to the ground.

node.title: Manufacturing sector expansion grows but Omicron worries remain
node.description: BNZ senior economist Craig Ebert said the positive result didn't tell the full picture and in unadjusted terms, four out of the nine industries were in contraction mode.

node.title: Can Labour counter National's 'Christophoria' buzz?
node.description: Power Play - National has found its version of "Jacindamania" - and Labour may struggle to counter it in this volatile climate, Craig McCulloch writes.

node.title: Tourism staffing concerns ahead of border reopening
node.description: The Tourism Minister has acknowledged businesses are concerned about staffing ahead of the border reopening, but says support will be there.

node.title: Police trial unmarked police motorbike in Canterbury
node.description: An unmarked police motorbike is being trialled in Canterbury.

node.title: Five injured after reports of shots fired in Auckland suburb
node.description: Multiple people were discovered injured after shots were fired in the Auckland suburb of Mt Roskill last night.

node.title: Australasian Anzac services to return to Gallipoli after two year break
node.description: New Zealand and Australian delegations will return to Gallipoli on Anzac Day this year.

node.title: Russia to ban Instagram after Meta allows posts calling for violence
node.description: Russia announced Instagram users have until March 14 to leave the platform after Meta allows Ukrainian calls for violence on its platforms.

node.title: What we know about BA.2 variant as it takes over in NSW
node.description: Just as Australians and other nations begin to enjoy renewed freedoms, a potentially more infectious coronavirus mutation is emerging.

node.title: East Cape residents warned to be prepared ahead of possible flooding
node.description: The head of Gisborne's civil defence has warned residents near East Cape to prepare to be cut off by flooding next week.

node.title: DNC weighs changes to presidential nominating process
node.description: The party is questioning the outsized role played by early-voting states like Iowa in determining the nominee.

node.title: Texas rejected at least 16,800 mail ballots in primary elections
node.description: Many were rejected because of problems related to complying with Texas' new voting law.

node.title: Prepare for petrol to reach $4 litre - AA says
node.description: Drivers should prepare to pay up to $4 a litre for petrol, according to the Automobile Association.

node.title: Biden signs spending bill that includes Ukraine aid
node.description: The new law includes $3.6 billion in assistance for Ukraine.

node.title: Gabby Petito's family sues Brian Laundrie's parents
node.description: The lawsuit contends that Laundrie told his parents on Aug. 28 that he had killed Petito, 22, his fiancee of about a year at the time. Her body was not found until September 19.

node.title: Texas judge temporarily blocks state from investigating trans medical care
node.description: A Texas judge has temporarily blocked the state from investigating parents who get gender affirming health care for their kids.

node.title: Police appeal for video footage of assault on Waikato Expressway
node.description: A man who was injured on the Waikato Expressway yesterday after being pulled from his vehicle and assaulted is in a critical but stable condition, police say.

node.title: Congress orders plaque to honor police officers who defended Capitol
node.description: It was mandated as part of the $1.5 trillion government funding legislation passed by Congress Thursday.

node.title: COVID vaccine less effective against Omicron in younger kids, study shows
node.description: Children were still three times less likely to be hospitalized with COVID-19 if they were vaccinated.
